FacilityName: Crest Foam Industries Incorporated - NJRMP version
FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Urethane and Other Foam Product (except Polystyrene) Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Crest Foam Industries IncorporatedA?s management is committed to operating a safe manufacturing facility.  The employees receive periodic refresher training and participate in annual emergency response exercises.

Crest Foam Industries Incorporated (Crest Foam) uses Toluene Diisocyanate (TDI) to manufacturer flexible polyurethane foam products.  TDI is received at the facility in tank truck and stored in aboveground storage tanks.

Crest Foam has developed a comprehensive program for the safe handling of TDI at their facility in Moonachie, New Jersey.  The program was initially developed in September 1988 for the New Jersey Toxic Catastrophe Prevention Act (TCPA).  The program has successfully operated since that time and has undergone regular audit by the New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection (NJDEP).  The facility Risk Management Plan (RMP) was upgraded in March 2010 from a Program level 2 to Program level 3 as New Jersey has eliminated the Program level 2. The RMP has been developed in accordance with the federal Accidental Release Prevention (ARP) and the New Jersey TCPA rules and consists of the following elements:


        Process Safety Information
        Process Hazard Analysis
        Standard Operating Procedures
        Combined Employee Training Program
        TDI Preventative Maintenance Program
        Management of Change
        Pre-Startup Safety Review
        Compliance Audit Procedures
        EHS Accident or Potentially Catastrophic Event Investigation Procedures
        Employee Participation Program
        Hot Work Permit
        Procedures for Outside Contract Employees
        Combined Emergency Response Plan


There have not been any TDI related accidents in the previous five years.

The facility has a comprehensive emergency response program.  The program is coordinated with the local emergency responders.  The facility has also contracted an outside emergency response company to respond to any major spills at the facility.
The facility employees are regularly trained in emergency response procedures. Crest Foam conducts annual emergency response exercises to evaluate facilityA?s emergency response program.
